description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 March 2024; doi:10.1038/s41563-024-01839-7

Misalignment-induced moiré patterns and chirality in two-dimensional materials offer vast opportunities for manipulating their properties, but they face challenges in synthesis and structural control.
title: Crafting moiré and chirality in two dimensions

description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 March 2024; doi:10.1038/s41563-024-01822-2

Cancer cells adjust the composition of their glycocalyx to increase its thickness and create a physical barrier that shields them from immune recognition and engagement.
title: A thicker skin for better immune evasion

description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 March 2024; doi:10.1038/s41563-024-01829-9

Beyond rare earths
title: Beyond rare earths

description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 March 2024; doi:10.1038/s41563-024-01805-3

The atomic reconstruction and stacking arrangement in twisted trilayer graphene with a range of varying twist angles are elucidated by four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy, revealing the hierarchical moiré of moiré superstructures that govern the structural symmetry at different length scales.
title: Unveiling the intricate moiré of moiré texture

description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 March 2024; doi:10.1038/s41563-024-01849-5

Author Correction: Topological Wannier cycles induced by sub-unit-cell artificial gauge flux in a sonic crystal
title: Author Correction: Topological Wannier cycles induced by sub-unit-cell artificial gauge flux in a sonic crystal

description:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 March 2024; doi:10.1038/s41563-024-01817-z

An orbitally ordered state in Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8+x is revealed, which splits the energy levels of oxygen orbitals by ~50 meV.
title: Discovery of orbital ordering in Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8+x
